title: Six straight wins later — are the Patriots officially back?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: The New England Patriots have achieved a six-game win streak under new head coach Mike Vrabel.
Rookie quarterback Drake Maye is being considered for the NFL MVP conversation amidst the Patriots' resurgence.
The Patriots hold a 7-2 record with notable performances from Stefon Diggs and Rhamondre Stevenson.

title: New UMass poll shows Markey with firm lead over Moulton
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: UMass Amherst/WCVB poll shows Sen. Ed Markey leading Rep. Seth Moulton 51% to 28% in Massachusetts Democratic primary race.
In a hypothetical race including Ayanna Pressley, Markey leads with 35%, followed by Moulton at 25% and Pressley at 21%.
Primary voters describe Markey as "old" and Moulton as "unknown," highlighting potential concerns for Markey as he seeks reelection.

title: Mass. man missing after leaving hospital early Friday morning
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Leonard Mercury, 57, went missing after leaving Heywood Hospital in Gardner, Massachusetts, around 2 a.m. on Friday.
Mercury was last seen heading towards a nearby bike path, wearing hospital clothing and no shoes.
Police urge anyone with information on Mercury's location to call 911 or Gardner police at 978-632-5600.

title: ‘We’re feeling that first-snow magic’: New England ski resorts delight in the season’s first snow
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: New England ski resorts experienced their first snowfall of the season, with Sunday River and Bretton Woods expressing excitement.
Bretton Woods in New Hampshire and Jay Peak in Vermont have scheduled openings on Nov. 28, following the first snow.
Stowe Mountain and Killington Resorts have started snowmaking for the upcoming season, with Stowe opening on Nov. 22.

title: 5 new restaurants we’re excited to try in November
author: Jillian Dara
bullets: All’Antico Vinaio, renowned for Florentine sandwiches, has opened a new location in Boston's Back Bay.
Capricho Colombian Steakhouse in Brookline offers Colombian flavors such as grilled meats and seafood dishes.
Twisted Fate Brewing expands with a new taproom in Revere, serving New England Hazy IPAs and other brews.

title: Former Gov. Charlie Baker’s father dies at 97
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Charles D. Baker III, father of former Gov. Charlie Baker, died in Needham at 97 on Saturday.
Baker had a notable career in government and was a trusted adviser to his son, former Gov. Charlie Baker.
He taught at Northeastern University and was well-regarded by students for his respectful and dignified approach.

title: Falcons accused Patriots of illegal simulation of a snap on crucial fourth quarter play
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Falcons accuse Patriots of simulating a snap with clapping, violating NFL's 'disconcerting signals' rule.
Incident occurred during fourth quarter, leading to Falcons' intentional grounding penalty and subsequent Patriots win.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel dismissed clapping allegations, humorously referring to the incident as 'Clapgate'.

title: A Worcester woman has been missing since leaving work Friday morning
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Joanna Brown, 30, went missing after leaving Bean Counter Bakery Cafe in Worcester on Friday around 9 a.m.
Brown is 5-foot-6 with hazel eyes, possibly in a 2025 Gray Mitsubishi Outlander, license plate 5GPN93.
Anyone with information is urged to contact Worcester Police at 508-799-8606 or call 911.

title: ‘Clapgate’: Mike Vrabel responded to Falcons’ accusations of Patriots’ illegal clapping
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel addressed 'Clapgate', denying the Patriots illegally simulated a snap during the win against the Falcons.
Vrabel expressed pride in DeMario Douglas' performance amid personal tragedy, offering support after learning of his uncle's death.
Vrabel dismissed claims of an easy schedule for the Patriots, noting the unpredictable nature of the NFL competition.

title: Lululemon shoplifting spree continues in Boston
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston Lululemon stores experienced their fourth shoplifting incident in just over a month, involving multiple suspects.
On Sunday, a group of 15 youths stole $4,000 worth of merchandise from the Boylston St. Lululemon location.
No arrests have been made; Boston police continue investigating the series of thefts affecting local Lululemon stores.
